{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1265 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 LucidaGrande;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\pardirnatural
\f0\fs26 \cf0 RUST will be installed in the /usr/local/ hierarchy: please make sure you $PATH include it.\ \ This version of RUST is 0.9, released on january 9, 2014 - compiled (on and) for Mac OSX 10.9(.1). It won't run on former releases of OSX because of a known limitation of the release - see issue #2024\ \ https://github.com/mozilla/rust/issues/2024\ \ Please feel free to make your own installation package for former releases of OSX.}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1265 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 HelveticaNeue;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;\red38\green38\blue38;} \deftab720 \pard\pardeftab720\sa400
\f0\fs28 \cf2 Rust is a curly-brace, block-structured expression language. \ It visually resembles the C language family, but differs significantly in syntactic and semantic details. Its design is oriented toward concerns of \'93programming in the large\'94, that is, of creating and maintaining \i boundaries \i0 \'96 both abstract and operational \'96 that preserve large-system \i integrity \i0 , \i availability \i0 and \i concurrency \i0 .\ It supports a mixture of imperative procedural, concurrent actor, object-oriented and pure functional styles. Rust also supports generic programming and metaprogramming, in both static and dynamic styles.\ For more information, please see http://www.rust-lang.org/\ Enjoy \\o/}
